headline.main: Red Hot Chili Peppers Didn't Play Instruments at Super Bowl

docs.snippet: With youthful enthusiasm, rah-rah coaching and some overlooked players, the Seahawks ran away with the Super Bowl and left others to figure out how to be more like them....
docs.lead_paragraph: With youthful enthusiasm, rah-rah coaching and some overlooked players, the Seahawks ran away with the Super Bowl and left others to figure out how to be more like them.
docs.abstract: John Branch on Pro Football column asserts that with youthful enthusiasm, rah-rah coaching and some overlooked players, Seattle Seahawks ran away with the Super Bowl, leaving others to figure out how to be more like them.

headline.main: For Seattle, the Fun May Be Just Starting
headline.print_headline: The Fun May Be Just Starting

docs.snippet: At each coaching stop, Pete Carroll massaged his approach, and proved willing to take in players of all backgrounds and personalities as long as they shared his competitive spirit....
docs.lead_paragraph: At each coaching stop, Pete Carroll massaged his approach, and proved willing to take in players of all backgrounds and personalities as long as they shared his competitive spirit.

headline.main: A Championship Built in Carroll’s Image
headline.print_headline: A Championship Built in Carroll’s Image

docs.snippet: A majority of the betting public counted on a storybook ending to quarterback Peyton Manning’s magical season, and it lost big as a result....
docs.lead_paragraph: A majority of the betting public counted on a storybook ending to quarterback Peyton Manning’s magical season, and it lost big as a result.
docs.abstract: Majority of the betting public counted on a storybook ending to Denver quarterback Peyton Manning’s magical season, and lost big as a result; Seattle Seahawks’ 43-8 destruction of the Broncos in the Super Bowl defied the expectations of most.

headline.main: Amid the Wreckage of the Broncos, Sports Books Strike Gold
headline.print_headline: Amid the Wreckage of the Broncos, Sports Books Strike Gold

docs.snippet: A golden lab puppy who refuses to leave his Clydesdale “bud” won plaudits; a Coca-Cola spot evoking the nation’s multicultural populace drew mostly positive reactions, but some raw comments as well....
docs.lead_paragraph: A golden lab puppy who refuses to leave his Clydesdale “bud” won plaudits; a Coca-Cola spot evoking the nation’s multicultural populace drew mostly positive reactions, but some raw comments as well.
docs.abstract: Advertising column; annual data after Super Bowl indicates that commercials during game that did best among consumers were feel-good spots meant to be uplifting, inspirational, nostalgic or patriotic; spot most discussed, liked and shared most was Anheuser-Busch ad for Budweiser beer featuring golden lab puppy.

headline.main: ‘Puppy Love’ Warms Hearts; Diversity Draws Mixed Response
headline.print_headline: ‘Puppy Love’ Warms Hearts; Diversity Draws Mixed Response

docs.snippet: About 28,000 riders took New Jersey Transit to the game at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, N.J., and more than 33,000 used it to leave....
docs.lead_paragraph: About 28,000 riders took New Jersey Transit to the game at MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, N.J., and more than 33,000 used it to leave.
docs.abstract: New Jersey Transit officials admit they significantly underestimated number of Super Bowl fans who would take trains to MetLife Stadium in East Rutherford, NJ, despite fact that organizers had coaxed fans for months to use public transportation on game day; about 28,000 riders took New Jersey Transit to game, and many encountered serpentine lines, waits of more than two hours and severe congestion on platforms.

headline.main: A Waiting Game After the Super Bowl: Hours in Line for the Train
headline.print_headline: Waiting Game After Super Bowl: Hours in Line for a Train

docs.snippet: Though Sunday’s game was a rout and a dud, the Super Bowl is so iconic an event that Fox was able to set viewership records even as the game’s intrigue faded....
docs.lead_paragraph: Though Sunday’s game was a rout and a dud, the Super Bowl is so iconic an event that Fox was able to set viewership records even as the game’s intrigue faded.
docs.abstract: Richard Sandomir TV Sports column holds that although game between Seattle Seahawks and Denver Broncos was a rout and a dud, Super Bowl is so iconic an event that Fox was able to set viewership records even as the game’s intrigue faded.

headline.main: Super Bowl Again Proves Bigger Than the Game Itself
headline.print_headline: Super Bowl Again Proves Bigger Than the Game Itself
